Issues.Title: fix(dev-infra): extract commit headers before checking commit message validity
Issues.Body:
This commit fixes an issue where adding `fixup` commits was triggering a lint error. The problem was caused by the fact that we used the entire message body while checking whether `fixup` commit has a corresponding "parent" commit in a range. This issue was found after enforcing a check that exits the process if there is an invalid commit message found (https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/4341743b4a6d7e23c6f944aa9e34166b701369a1).

Issues.Title: feat(common): introduce the `watchCollection` pipe
Issues.Body:
The `watchCollection` pipe is used to track the contents of an array
or key/value map and then create a new copy once a change is detected.

This pipe can be used to signal input bindings whenever the contents
of a collection change.

```html
<!-- [values] only gets fired when the `myValues` input
     value changes in identity (when the value is rewritten) -->
<my-comp [values]="myValues"></my-comp>

<!-- [values] will now get updated whenever the `myValues`
     collection changes in identity or content -->
<my-comp [values]="myValues | watchCollection"></my-comp>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(common): introduce the `watchCollection` pipe" (#36731)

Issues.Title: fix(dev-infra): exit non-zero if commit message validation failed
Issues.Body:
Currently the `commit-message` validation script does not exit
with a non-zero exit code if the commit message validation failed.

This means that invalid commit messages are currently not
causing CI to be red. See: https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular/686008

@josephperrott I think we _could_ update the required base sha in the merge script one this PR lands. Not sure if we want to do that though (as it introduces slow-down due to rebasing I guess)

Issues.Title: Instance of service from NgModule.imports is not being injected in NgModule constructor or declared components
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? I don't know ### Description I have an issue with DI/NgModule. Injected `TranslateService` in `SharedModule` constructor (or `SharedComponent` constructor) is different than expected. From my understanding the nearest instance in DI hierarchy should be injected, which should be an instance registered from `TranslateModule.forChild()` (`TranslateLoader` + `TranslateService`) defined in `SharedModule.imports`. But instead `TranslateService` with `LazyTranslateLoader` (from `LazyModule`) is injected. I've tried `SkipSelf()` in `SharedModule` or change order of imports in `LazyModule` or even define providers directly in `SharedModule` without using `TranslateModule.forChild()` but nothing has changed. Only thing that works is to define providers directly on `SharedComponent`, but it's unfortunate because then I need to modify all components within `SharedModule`. I couldn't find existing opened/closed issue which would be relevant to this. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - open console, there are logs https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-4ckgm4?file=src%2Fapp%2Fshared-module%2Fshared.module.ts ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: AngularJS $compile equivalent in Angular - compile string to HTML
Issues.Body: # üöÄ feature request ### Relevant Package `"@angular/core": "9.1.1"` or any Angular 2+ version ### Description AngularJS had an option to programatically and easily compile HTML out of a string with all the bindings and directives in it. So if we were to compile AngularJS-recognisable HTML out of a string (i.e. `Click here `), we could do that. See it in action on [StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angularjs-compile-html-from-string-example?file=ng1%2Fng1-demo.component.ts) and [GitHub repo](https://github.com/ease/angularjs-angular-compile-html). Starting from Angular, we are no more able to do that. I've tried some solutions explained in section below, but they simply were not adequate. I also haven't found that anyone around seemed to find solution to this. It's actually the downside of migrating to Angular. ### Describe the solution you'd like I don't know how you should be doing it, but it needs to be the syntax similar to previous. Best I did was the following, using [Renderer2](https://angular.io/api/core/Renderer2): ```.ts let textToCompile = `Click here `; let div = this.renderer.createElement('div') as HTMLDivElement; div.innerHTML = textToCompile; this.renderer.appendChild(this.elementRef.nativeElement, div); ``` but `"(click)="doSomething({property: 'value'})"` was unrecognised value for Angular, so no click was triggered, and I didn't want to hack with some `addEventListener("click")` stuff, because it's not the Angular way. ### Describe alternatives you've considered I was trying to achieve this by dynamically loading components, using `ViewContainerRef`, `ComponentFactoryResolver` and appropriate methods such as [createComponent](https://angular.io/api/core/ViewContainerRef#createComponent), without success. I see no any relation between these two things, as some other members of community have suggested. That simply doesn't serve the same purpose. As I'm not a contributor, I couldn't reopen https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/6886 or https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/25871, but this feature now becomes even more important as projects become more advanced solutions nowadays. Thanks in advance and please comment or react if you've encountered the same problem, so that Angular team knows it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "AngularJS $compile equivalent in Angular - compile string to HTML" (#36719)

Issues.Title: Support extend angularCompilerOptions in tsconfig from absolute tsconfig
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

@alan-agius4 https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/22684

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description


I know that extends works if we use a config regarding our file system

tsconfig.angular.json

```json5
{
      "angularCompilerOptions": {
        "strictTemplates": true,
        "fullTemplateTypeCheck": true,
        "annotateForClosureCompiler": true,
        "strictInjectionParameters": true,
        "skipTemplateCodegen": false,
        "preserveWhitespaces": true,
        "skipMetadataEmit": false,
        "disableTypeScriptVersionCheck": true
    }
}
```

tsconfig.json

```json5
{
    "extends": "./tsconfig.angular.json",
    "compilerOptions": {
        "baseUrl": "./src",
        "module": "esnext",
        "target": "es2015",
        "outDir": "./dist/out-tsc",
        "lib": ["es2017", "es2018", "dom"]
    }
}
```

Works great

But If I put the config in a separate package


```json5
{
    "extends": "@my-company/tsconfig",
    "compilerOptions": {
        "baseUrl": "./src",
        "module": "esnext",
        "target": "es2015",
        "outDir": "./dist/out-tsc",
        "lib": ["es2017", "es2018", "dom"]
    }
}
```

Only inheritance compilerOptions works,  but I expect angularCompilerOptions to be inherited too

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction


```
$ npm i @angular-ru/tsconfig
```

```json5
{
    "extends": "@angular-ru/tsconfig",
    "compilerOptions": {
        "baseUrl": "./src",
        "module": "esnext",
        "target": "es2015",
        "outDir": "./dist/out-tsc",
        "lib": ["es2017", "es2018", "dom"]
    }
}
```

```
$ ng build
```

Works without angularCompilerOptions inherited properties

@alan-agius4 What do you think about this, is it a bug?

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**

Angular 8.2.14
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support extend angularCompilerOptions in tsconfig from absolute tsconfig" (#36715)

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/localize


### Description
Currently, the `$localize` API is not documented, and translation text & id is not extracted towards translation file, basically the translation units for a text translated with `$localize` in code have to be put in a translation unit in the file manually.

If you have many items to translate with `$localize` it will add load to the team, it multiplies the load by the number of locales you need to support, since each time you merge the source locale into any other locale file, with the VSCode Angular i18n plugin (and very likely with many other xlf merge utilities), those translation units you added manually will be removed and you're forced to either look into git to undo those you added by hand or add them back again.

Here's the math, if you have, say 10 items localized from code, you support 10 languages or locales, you have to re-visit 100 translation units every time you make changes that require changes in the source locale file, which is very often when you make new features or fix a typo, adding tons of load, not to mention being highly error-prone.


### Describe the solution you'd like
All `$localize` calls are extracted into the translation file as translation units, and documentation is updated.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
At the very least make the extraction work, I could take care of the docs later since I've meddled quite a bit with the `$localize` API for enterprise projects:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9698639/79721852-a99d5b00-82a8-11ea-924f-7b44089dbd09.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[i18n] $localize extract translation unit & documentation" (#36714)

export enum SignInProviderType {
  Google,

  Email,
  Phone,
  Github,

Issues.Title: some elements don't load to page after upgrading to angular9, (Ivy enable, prod mode only)
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core 9.x.x ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: @angular/core 8.x.x although when I disable Ivy compiler I won't see the bug in @angular/core9.x.x ### Description We have an Enterprise application was written by angular. everything was ok until we upgraded to angular9. then some components stop being shown in application. when I deep through the problem I found that angular9 Ivy component have some different mechanisms such as tree shaking, and that might cause some of my code considered as dead code. this is my assumption that Ivy engine wrongly eliminate some of our elements in the html. Or maybe sometimes angular binding don't work perfect ! In develop mode by running the `ng serve` and when we **disable Ivy engine** in production mode `ng build --prod` then every thing is Ok. When Ivy is enable in production mode I see this when I inspect element that is eliminated. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15701921/79715603-6a432e80-82e9-11ea-8033-3bc9e048aa89.png) and this is the html code of this part : ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15701921/79716244-5c8ea880-82eb-11ea-9061-d473a7ffc719.png) Note that searchResult is a list with some elements and is not empty! I see some other bugs in this page as well, I have another component in this page called **market-depth** which is defined in costume library. when I comment this component then above list works perfect!!! ## üî• Exception or Error noting is shown as exception of error in developer console. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 


 angular 9.1.2
**Anything else relevant?**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "some elements don't load to page after upgrading to angular9, (Ivy enable, prod mode only)  " (#17510)

Issues.Title: docs: add notes about various release foot-guns
Issues.Body:
This is a few different edits to make caretakers more aware of problems that can occur during a release.
* Added a comment to reinforce that pushing tags needs to happen with the push of the release commit. Otherwise CI can fail `npm install` because the relevant tags are not set.
* Changed to check out the publish branch rather than the tag because checking out a tag fails the subsequent `publish` command.
* Added `yarn` before the `publish` command because dependencies may be out of date and cause errors.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs: add notes about various release foot-guns" (#17496)

Issues.Title: Production build changes app behavior (some required code is removed from the bundle)
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/.... ### Is this a regression? Not sure ### Description Leaflet library contains the following code: https://github.com/Leaflet/Leaflet/blob/984fedda1c48d141f018ca45ae06738872d7f5dd/src/layer/tile/GridLayer.js#L393-L394 Looks like it's a kind of hack that forces a browser to update a page layout and to start the animation (css transition). https://stackoverflow.com/a/24195559/1989716 In dev build everything works as expected. When using `ng build --prod` mentioned above lines are removed from the bundle: `this._setZoomTransform(i,r.getCenter(),r.getZoom()),this._onCreateLevel(i))` so the animation is broken. Issues.Title: Wrong jasmine/wd2 typings in Angular 8/9
Issues.Body:
I created a new blank angular 9 project using next commands:
```
ng new my-app
npm install
ng serve
```

I added `then()` to test:

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1265588/79538710-28b24980-8085-11ea-8379-1999480d1fb1.png)

Then run:

```
ng test
```

Error occured:

```
ERROR in src/app/app.component.spec.ts:20:30 - error TS2339: Property 'then' does not exist on type 'boolean'.

20     expect(app).toBeTruthy().then(() => { });
                                ~~~~
```

After removing **"@types/jasminewd2": "~2.0.3",** from **package.json**, deleting **then()** of course and running:

```
npm install
ng test // no compilation error
```

Visual studio code reported that expect() matcher is **sync method** and returns boolean instead of Promise, just removed the .then() and everything works as it should.
```
## my environment

**Angular Version:**
Angular CLI: 9.1.1
Node: 12.16.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.1.2
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------

@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.901.1
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.901.1
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.901.1
@angular-devkit/core              9.1.1
@angular-devkit/schematics        9.1.1
@angular/cli                      9.1.1
@ngtools/webpack                  9.1.1
@schematics/angular               9.1.1
@schematics/update                0.901.1
rxjs                              6.5.5
typescript                        3.8.3
webpack                           4.42.0

D:\my-app>node -v
v12.16.1

D:\my-app>npm -v
6.13.4
```
Not really sure this is an Angular bug, but package @types/jasminewd2 comes by default I suppose.

Issues.Title: Errors are reported differently depending on when you execute `npm start`
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes. In Angular v8 and before, the browser would consistently show errors, regardless of when you executed `npm start` ### Description What you see in the browser when you have an error depends on when you execute `npm start`. You may get this: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7987365/79477249-dc043b00-7fbe-11ea-9d87-d084a9a6615f.png) No error shown. Appears to display the last successfully compiled files. You may get this: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7987365/79477354-f76f4600-7fbe-11ea-885f-8e2205951a3a.png) Get error. This is very unhelpful, especially for Angular beginners. This appears if you run `npm start` after making an error. It appears that it cannot serve any files in this case. Or you may get lucky and get this: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7987365/79477536-2a193e80-7fbf-11ea-80cb-bf6c32213bea.png) This is much more helpful, but not consistently shown. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction This is one example, but it happens with many different errors, such as forgetting to add a component to an Angular module: 1) ng new APM 2) cd APM 3) code . 4) Run npm start 5) Add the following line to the template: ` ` (This is an error because we don't have listFilter defined and we have not imported FormsModule.) 6) View the browser. No error. 7) Using the F12 tools, you see the ngModel error. 8) Stop the compiler. 9) Restart the compiler and you see the black background and an error in the browser. I assume this is the behavior that we *should* see in every case. 10) Remove the added input line. The code does not recompile and the browser still shows the error. So it appears as if it was not fixed. 11) Stop the compiler. 12) Add the above input element again (step #5) 13) Start the compiler. 14) This time you'll see the `cannot get` error. So depending on when the `npm start` is executed, the developer will see different results, some of which, like the `cannot get` error, provide no information in the browser as to what is wrong. ## üî• Exception or Error
## üåç Your Environment 



@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.901.1
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.901.1
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.901.1
@angular-devkit/core              9.1.1
@angular-devkit/schematics        9.1.1
@ngtools/webpack                  9.1.1
@schematics/angular               9.1.1
@schematics/update                0.901.1
rxjs                              6.5.5
typescript                        3.8.3
webpack                           4.42.0
**Anything else relevant?**

Issues.Title: fix(form-field): error in newer sass versions
Issues.Body:
One internal Sass mixin was referring to the `$mat-form-field-outline-dedupe` as if it's a global, however the variable is local to the file. In previous Sass version this created a global variable silently, but in the newer ones it's a warning and it'll eventually become an error.

Also bumps our local version of Sass.

Fixes #19122.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(form-field): error in newer sass versions" (#19127)

Issues.Title: mat-contrast sass mixin provides failing accessibility colors
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
When using mat-contrast in sass from angular/material/theming the color provided doesn't pass accessibility standards for WCAG AA for normal text. Also doesn't follow the color guidelines from the material color tool

#### What is the expected behavior?
Provide color that meets accessibility standards

#### What is the current behavior?
doesn't

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://angular-ujpp3f.stackblitz.io
you can see in this example of utilizing mat-teal 600 and the given mat-contrast you can key in the values here: https://monsido.com/tools/contrast-checker and see that it fails AA standard for normal text.


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
It feels misleading to have this functionality and for it to not pass web standards.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
angular/material 7-9

#### Is there anything else we should know?
This is not limited to all colors, but each palette seems to have at least one that is wrong.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-contrast sass mixin provides failing accessibility colors" (#19123)

Issues.Title: help[matDatepickerFilter]: Getting error while updating a matdatepicker which uses matDatepickerFilter.
Issues.Body:
I am trying to disable some dates based on an array. It work fine when the datepicker has no value. when I set some value datepicker programatically, it does not recognizes the array and throws error.

### The Error
`core.js:5873 ERROR TypeError: Cannot read property 'some' of undefined
    at MatDatepickerInput.ApplyLeaveDialogComponent.blockWeekendAndLeaves [as _dateFilter] (apply-leave-dialog.component.ts:52)
    at MatDatepickerInput._filterValidator (datepicker.js:3868)
    at forms.js:1528
    at Array.map (<anonymous>)
    at _executeValidators (forms.js:1524)
    at MatDatepickerInput._validator (forms.js:1466)
    at MatDatepickerInput.validate (datepicker.js:4022)
    at forms.js:1583
    at forms.js:1528
    at Array.map (<anonymous>)`

### The Code which disables certain dates:
`blockWeekendAndLeaves = (d: Date): boolean => {
    const day = d.getDay();
    if (this.holidayList
      .some(holiday =>
        moment(holiday.holiday_date)
          .format('MM/DD/YYYY') === moment(d)
            .format('MM/DD/YYYY')) || day === 0 || day === 6) {
      return false;
    }
    return true;
  }`
### HTML
`  <mat-form-field>
            <mat-label>Select Start Date</mat-label>
            <input [matDatepickerFilter]="blockWeekendAndLeaves" matInput [matDatepicker]="leave_from_date"
                placeholder="Choose a date" formControlName="leave_from_date">
            <mat-datepicker-toggle matSuffix [for]="leave_from_date"></mat-datepicker-toggle>
            <mat-datepicker #leave_from_date></mat-datepicker>
        </mat-form-field>`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "help[matDatepickerFilter]: Getting error while updating a matdatepicker which uses matDatepickerFilter." (#19121)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): drop-list wrong enter position
Issues.Body:
Parent rect should be cached again when the new item has been added.
![issue video](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1423005/79694947-1813f600-8274-11ea-838e-0d1e4468a7f5.gif)

If item is entering from start (left/top) it should be inserted in the first position from the beginning to avoid "jump effect"
![issue video](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1423005/79694962-32e66a80-8274-11ea-8314-72fdd4e763f1.gif)

When looking for item index from pointer position exclude right/bottom pixel: that pixel is external.
![issue video](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1423005/79694970-4d204880-8274-11ea-9828-4bf24eb34ae8.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): drop-list wrong enter position" (#19116)

Issues.Title: fix(input): avoid repeat accesses to check if element is a textarea
Issues.Body: Since the node's type can't change, it's unnecessary to check the DOM in the `_isTextarea` on every invocation. This affects the MDC form field in particular since it's used in a data binding.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(input): avoid repeat accesses to check if element is a textarea" (#19115)

Issues.Title: fix(autocomplete/testing): incorrect options if multiple panels are on the page at the same time

Issues.Title: fix(radio): incorrect text color when placed inside an overlay with a dark theme

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(radio): incorrect text color when placed inside an overlay with a dark theme" (#19113)

Issues.Title: fix(select/testing): incorrect options if multiple selects are on the page at the same time
Issues.Body:
Fixes the test harness always retrieving the options for the first select when there are multiple selects on the page.

Fixes #19075.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(select/testing): incorrect options if multiple selects are on the page at the same time" (#19112)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): boundary not accounting for parent scrolling
Issues.Body:
In #18612 some logic was added to update the boundary dimensions when the page is scrolled, however that logic didn't account for the case where a parent element is being scrolled. We were already handling parent elements for the drop list so these changes move the logic into a separate class so it can be reused and fix the issue for the drag item.

Fixes #19086.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): boundary not accounting for parent scrolling" (#19108)

Issues.Title: Can't bind to 'expanded' since it isn't a known property of 'mat-accordion'.([mat-accordion]): [Cannot use expanded on MatAccordion]
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: 

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-k7rbu9?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Using the input prop of [expanded]="true" not recognised by MatExpansionModule aka mat-accordion 
2. See Stackblitz --> https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-k7rbu9?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html
 

 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
Hello! I am trying to only have the accordion functional on the mobile view. Desktop view - I will be removing the toggle button with [hideToggle]="true" (this works) and have all panels expanded. So I have tried to make them all expand in a few ways. 
1. I tried to use a function call ``this.matAccordion.openAll();`` by executing it AfterViewInit, 
2. I've tried [expanded]="true" 

**Neither work and I get this error for #2 with ``Can't bind to 'expanded' since it isn't a known property of 'mat-accordion'.``
** Get this error with #1 ``ERROR TypeError: Cannot read property 'openAll' of undefined``

Also once I expand the view I will be disabling with [disabled]=true but that also throws an error similar to the error I get with #2.
``Can't bind to 'disabled' since it isn't a known property of 'mat-accordion'.``
#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
1. The [expanded]="true" should expand all panels of the accordion
2. The [disabled]="true" should not allow user to collapse or expand the the accordian
3. this.matAccordion.openAll() should work on an Angular lifecycle

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.0+
- CDK/Material: 9.0+
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Mac Os
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can't bind to 'expanded' since it isn't a known property of 'mat-accordion'.([mat-accordion]): [Cannot use expanded on MatAccordion]" (#19101)

Issues.Title: Drag and Drop between tables
Issues.Body:
Hi,
I am trying to implement drag and drop feature between two tables.
So basically the idea is to drag from one table to another table and which ever row is dragged it should have a relation with the particular row of the other table.The same rows can have multiple relations as well and this functionality can be also be used with other tables as well.

Kindly shed some information on this to how can this be implemented.
 
#### What is the expected behavior?
Expected behavior is to have have many-many relation as well as one-many relation between both tables. 

#### What is the current behavior?
Currently only a one-one functionality is working and that to is not getting implemented with other tables as well.
#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
I am using Angular 6.

Issues.Title: bug(MatCheckbox): fails to toggle when the binding is updated in the click handler.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-l69cmq?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts

1. Bind a MatCheckbox to a property on a component class.
2. Set the property value to true in a click handler on the checkbox.
3. Click the checkbox.
 
#### Expected Behavior

The input handles the click event first and toggles the checkbox value. The property value is already true when the parent's click handler is executed.

#### Actual Behavior

The click hander sets the property to true, and the form control toggles the checkbox before the input handle's the click event. The checkbox is toggled twice and remains false with one click.

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.1
- CDK/Material: 9.2.0
- Browser(s): Chrome 80.0.3987.163
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS Catalina

Given the comment at the top of _onInputClick (checkbox.ts line 399), I would guess that the parent is handling the label's click event and the label is triggering the input's click event. Therefore, the input handles the click event after the parent.

This may be expected based on the implementation or get fixed as result of the MDC migration. This issue is useful for my tracking open or closed.

### Workarounds

- Cancel the event in the click handler.
- Perform side effects as a reaction to the checkbox value change using the change event or getters and setters.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatCheckbox): fails to toggle when the binding is updated in the click handler." (#19100)
